title: The Scroll of Console
subtitle: Your First C# Command
description:
# Welcome to C# Quest!

You've discovered an ancient scroll that contains the most fundamental spell in all of C# programming: **the Console.WriteLine spell**.

This spell allows you to display messages to the console - a window where your code communicates with you.

## The Console.WriteLine Spell

In C#, the print spell looks like this:

```csharp
Console.WriteLine("Hello, warrior!");
```

**How it works:**
- `Console.WriteLine` is the spell name
- The parentheses `()` hold the message you want to display
- The quotation marks `""` tell C# this is text (called a **string**)
- **The semicolon `;` ends the statement** (required in C#!)

## Important C# Rules

⚠️ **Always end statements with a semicolon (;)**
⚠️ **C# is case-sensitive**: `Console` must have capital C
⚠️ **Use double quotes** for strings: `"text"`

## Your Quest

Cast the Console.WriteLine spell to display the message:

**Welcome to C# Quest!**

Then, on a new line, cast another spell to display:

**I am ready to learn C#!**
